intro: Chrysanthemum marginatum, commonly known as the margined chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China and Korea. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, often featuring distinctive marginal markings. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring moderate watering. Chrysanthemum marginatum is also valued for its use in traditional medicine.
